Case reference: 2014004050.CaseDesc: On Saturday, June 25, 1994, Stephen Tudor was participating in a one man (solo) sailboat race from Port Huron to Mackinac Island.  The sailboat he was sailing, the "ANERIRIN" was located abandoned along the Goderich, Ontario shoreline. Police were unable to locate any signs of Mr. Tudor.

Case reference: 2014004763.CaseDesc: On October 28, 2005, Leslie Thompson was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Leslie is known as a gambler and frequents bars.

Case reference: 2006007599.CaseDesc: Leland Iseler was last seen October 9, 1967, at a hunt camp on the Mattagami River,  near Cypress Falls, 30 miles north of Smooth Rock Falls.  His boat was found anchored about 100 feet off shore and his fishing rod was missing. Leland Iseler has never been located.

Case reference: 2020006482.CaseDesc: On January 11, 1990, Emabit Yafru travelled from Ethiopia to Toronto, Ontario. On January 25, 1990, her husband came to Toronto and could not locate her. During the time of her disappearance, Emabit was five months pregnant.

Case reference: 2007004499.CaseDesc: Rod Pavan was last heard from on August 10, 2007. Mr. Pavan advised his landlord that he was moving to British Columbia that day. His vehicle was later found near Shannon Lake Road, north of Val Cote, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006028499.CaseDesc: On August 3, 1968, at approximately 4:30 p.m., Robert James Brown was last seen walking  from the Nazarene Camp to his home in the Village of Wilfred, Ontario. The Nazarene Camp was a Christian camp near Pefferlaw, where Robert's mother worked as a volunteer.  He never arrived home and was reported missing to the Georgina Township Police Service. There were reports that a person matching Robert's description was seen in the vicinity of Georgina Beach around the time that Robert was last seen. Numerous land and water searches failed to locate Robert.

Case reference: 2014003667.CaseDesc: On May 23, 1996, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Kevin Lotysz was seen for the last time as he left the McKellar Hospital in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Kevin is an avid drummer and enjoys music.

Mark: Cheek, Birthmark on lower right cheek
Tattoo: Chest, Sword on left side of chest

Case reference: 2014005853.CaseDesc: On Friday August 10, 2012, Bernice Carnahan was last seen from the Rabbit Lake Saskatchewan area at approximately 9:00 a.m. At approximately 11:45 p.m. that evening, Ms. Carnahan's abandoned vehicle was located in the Battleford area near Finlayson Island but her whereabouts remain unknown.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wire rimmed

Case reference: 2014005498.CaseDesc: David Rocque was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 2010.  David was last heard from by a family member in March 2010.  Prior to David's disappearance, he normally maintained contact with his family at least once a month.  He resided in Edmonton but had spent time in northern Alberta, St. Paul area.

Scar: Left Cheek, 51mm close to the eye

Case reference: 2009005099.CaseDesc: Russell Hoffert was a voluntary patient of the North Bay Psychiatric Hospital, Highway 11 North, in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Hoffert walked away from the hospital grounds, in poor winter like weather and was not properly dressed for the conditions. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000145.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Ralph Simington. He was last seen in Calgary, Alberta on June 15, 2012.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2006028299.CaseDesc: Shawn McConkey was last seen leaving work on December 21, 2001. That same day, his vehicle was involved in a single vehicle collision on County Road #22 in Otonabee-South Monaghan Township. No one was located at the scene of the accident. A search of the area has failed to locate Mr. McConkey and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Shirt: Denim, Blue, Emblem over left pocket and name over right pocket
Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Picture of a skull and the word "Tom"
Right Hand, Trees and a cross
Right Upper Arm , Picture of Hitler

Case reference: 2014002760.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1976, a witness saw Claude Houle fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. His body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2014002185.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1977, Géraldine Dufresne was seen for the last time at her residence in the Montréal-Nord district of Montreal, Quebec. Géraldine did not report to work, nor did she inform her employer of her absence. All of her belongings were left in her apartment.

Case reference: 2012020162.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the Fraser River near New Westminster.

Teeth: Protruding Lowers, distinctive under bite, missing a number of teeth which would have resulted in a unique smile
Jewelry: Silver, Brown, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Swiss made watch, 4 diamond inserts, serial number 8564524
Shoes: Other, "Transit" brand burgundy shoes with brown laces
Shirt: Cotton, Beige, T-shirt "Fruit of the Loom" brand
Cotton, Grey, "Tip Top" brand golf shirt
Jacket: Cotton, Beige, "Colorado" brand fleece with grey stripes on the sleeves

Case reference: 2021035166.CaseDesc: On July 10, 2021, Nicole Frenchman was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Nicole was living with her friends, but had no fixed address. Nicole was normally very active on social media but has not accessed it since her disappearance.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Leopard print
Right Side Of Neck, Red kiss lips
Right Hand, "Queen dubs dollar sign" on the middle finger
Right Forearm, Dreamcatcher; feathers; "Trust no one"
Pierce: Upper Lip, Monroe piercing on left side

Case reference: 2012020070.CaseDesc: Leslie Thomas was reported missing December 8, 2000.  He was last seen walking west on Hwy #201 of the Roseau River First Nation in the first week of November.  Mr. Thomas' whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020080.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2004, at 11:30 p.m., Courtney Struble, 13 years old, was last seen walking towards her residence in Estevan, SK. There have been reported sightings of Courtney, however, despite investigations and searches, she has not been located.

Mark: Neck, birthmark at nape of neck

Case reference: 2014005581.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2011, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Steven Lapowich was last seen at Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Steven boarded a flight to Puerto Rico, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2014001087.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2001, a woman was found dead near the Allan Memorial Pavilion at the Royal Victoria Hospital in Montreal. With the help of a forensic artist, a face reconstruction was made. The woman wore gray clothes similar to those used by hospital patients.

Shoes: White, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, "Aerocourt" running shoes brand, size 8

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2014003073.CaseDesc: Michael Hammond was last seen on November 24, 1991 at his residence in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014006180.CaseDesc: Tammy Penner has not been in contact with friends or family since 2005. Tammy did not live in one place for any significant period of time, and has traveled across Canada. Prior to her disappearance, she had been living in Chilliwack and Abbotsford in British Columbia. Tammy suffered from a drug dependency.

Case reference: 2018063868.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2018, Apu Akbar was last seen by his roommates at his home in St. John’s, Newfoundland. Mr. Akbar’s grey Honda Civic was located on November 8, 2018, in the area of Kavanagh’s Lane and Windgap Road in Flatrock, Newfoundland. The keys were still in the ignition and his cellphone was found in the vehicle. Apu is originally from Bangladesh.

Case reference: 2012020058.CaseDesc: Roger Keesick has been missing since May of 1986.  He is very handy with woodworking and renovating.  He is also known to associate with a lot of street people.  Mr. Keesick last told his family that he was going to work at a fishing lodge outside of Winnipeg.  It was later discovered that he had never made it there.

Scar: Report only indicates "body scars"; no location indicated

Case reference: 2016026140.CaseDesc: Amber Wilson was last seen at 9:30pm on May 15, 2016, in Edmonton's downtown area. Amber has medical issues, and she is dependent on her medication. Amber lives a high risk lifestyle, and it is out of character for her not to be in contact with her family. Her family is extremely concerned for her welfare.

Case reference: 2014004992.CaseDesc: On October 12, 2004, at approximately 11:30 a.m., Kim Evans was seen for the last time at the North York Women’s Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Kim had said she was going to her family’s residence to collect her personal belongings.

Pierce: Nose, Nose ring on the right side

Case reference: 2015050297.CaseDesc: On April, 23, 1973, Lucie Gélinas was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. She was supposed to go to Vancouver, British Columbia with a friend. Investigations were conducted and the location of Lucie and her friend have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014001040.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1990, the remains of a man were found at the north end of the Burrard Bridge in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had several healed fractures, including one on the right side of the skull. It is estimated that he may have died sometime after May 1989.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Arm, Healed fractures on ulna and radius
Left Calf, Old fracture on fibula and tibia
Nose, Healed fracture displaced towards left side
Right Side Of Head, Old fracture right zygomatic arch
Back Of Head, Healed old fractures to right temporo occipital

Case reference: 2014005890.CaseDesc: On February 15, 2012, Marie Antoinette Carlson was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Marie has been known to travel to Calgary, Alberta and Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002883.CaseDesc: George Myrick was last seen on March 16, 1987, when he went duck hunting, but he never returned to St. Shott’s, Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2009005299.CaseDesc: David Chevrier suffers from schizophrenia and functions at a low intellectual level. He was last seen at the Centre of Friends on Main street in North Bay.

Case reference: 2012020131.CaseDesc: Gilles Parisien, 53, was reported missing October 28, 2003. A witness claims to have seen him on October 9, 2003 in Malartic. At the time of his disappearance, he was at the Malartic Hospital Center.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014006024.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2013, Richard Bailey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was reported missing by his wife the next day when he failed to return home from work.

Case reference: 2021038782.CaseDesc: On June 17, 2017, at approximately 7:50 p.m., John Shankland was last seen near the Brink of the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, John was despondent.

Shirt: Yellow, TEE SHIRT, T-shirt; “volunteer for MS, New York Chapter 2010”
Scar: Right Forearm, Three-inch scar from cancer surgery

Case reference: 2016050062.CaseDesc: On August 31, 2016, Jami Springer was last seen in Moncton, New Brunswick.  Since then, no one has heard or seen Jami, and the police consider her disappearance as suspicious.

Case reference: 2014027689.CaseDesc: Sindy Ruperthouse's family has had no news of her since April 2014 and on September 2, 2014, they reported her missing to the Sûreté du Québec of Amos. Mrs. Ruperthouse was last seen in Val d'Or on April 22, 2014 during a consultation at the Local Community Service Centre (CLSC).

Case reference: 2013000097.CaseDesc: On January 25th, 1981, police received a call regarding the drowning of Deanne Bousquet. Three children were playing on the ice on the river when two of the children broke through. Deanne was unable to pull herself out and was last seen going under the water. Ice in the area was very thin due to warm water being dumped by the mill. All efforts made to locate Deanne were negative.

Case reference: 2018063467.CaseDesc: On December 12, 1995, at approximately 2:00 am, Ahmad Kharashfeh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Short jacket with 2 red lines in the front

Case reference: 2014005409.CaseDesc: Rene Bruneau was last seen at Saskatchewan Hospital in North Battleford on June 27, 1965. Mr. Bruneau was noticed missing the next morning. He is from Leoville, Saskatchewan. His immediate family have not heard from or seen Mr. Bruneau.

Scar: Head, Surgical scar on forehead, ear to ear, from removal of tumour

Case reference: 2009002699.CaseDesc: Norman Welsh was on holidays with his mother and an incident occurred on July 18, 1976, which subsequently led him to the hospital. While in the hospital he was described as bitter and un-cooperative wanting to return home in St Catharines. While being escorted to the North Bay Pyschiatric Hospital (now Northeast Mental Health Centre), he ran off into the wooded area.

Teeth: Stained, Has a 2 tooth partial plate and is missing his front upper left tooth, teeth slightly stained
Scar: Head, Under the hair, due to an operation at the age of 16

Case reference: 2005006299.CaseDesc:
On June 16 1977, the body of a male was recovered from the Niagara River at the Canadian Niagara Power House above the Niagara Falls. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 200-210 lbs and his length was measured at 5'8", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix is present and he may have suffered from high blood pressure, diabetes and/or alcoholism. He may have also suffered from pancreatitis in the past. He is thought to have been in the water for approximately 1 to 2 months.

Teeth: Partial acrylic denture:upper incisors and some premolars. Lost all lower molars and lower right 2nd premolar prior to death.
Shirt: Plaid shirt, blue and cream coloured

Case reference: 2012020105.CaseDesc: Marilyn Bergeron, has been missing since February 17, 2008, from St-Romuald, Québec.

Boots: Suede, Black, with a fur trimmed contour
Coat: Black, Long coat with a fur hood

Case reference: 2014005841.CaseDesc: Alfred Sassin has not been seen since he left his home in downtown Vancouver on July 9, 2012. Mr. Sassin's absence was reported to police by the resident caretakers on July 16, as they had not seen him for over a week, which was unusual for him.

Case reference: 2015011652.CaseDesc: On December 8, 1998, a ship from Lisbon arrived at the port of Montreal. The captain of the ship discovered the body of a man in the back part of the liner. The captain thinks it's a stowaway.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2016059837.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2001, a male was found in the Detroit River, near 4200 block on Sandwich Street. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 138 lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water a few days to a few months.

Hair: Short curly black hair on the left side of face
Teeth: Full gold crown on the lower left second molar
Jewelry: Braided, unknown if anklet or bracelet
Gold, Ears, Clear stone stud earrings
Ring: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Right Little Finger, 2 rings
Shirt: Black, Hooded sweatshirt with "Providence Friars" written on the front
Shorts: Blue, Gold, "Champion" brand short with the "University of Michigan" logo

Case reference: 2017001353.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2016 at 2:00 a.m., Derek Ritz was last seen on foot in Sebringville, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005000.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2004, Mr. Lathlin was reported missing to police by his wife. She indicated to police the last time she saw Mr. Lathlin was on June 14th at which time he was leaving for Winnipeg from The Pas for a medical appointment on the 15th. He did not take any clothing and only took personal grooming items. Mr. Lathlin later called advising his wife he would be staying in Winnipeg as he had another appointment on Thursday. He again called his wife on Saturday morning asking for money. His wife sent the money as requested, however by Tuesday it was not claimed and it was returned to her. Mr. Lathlin has a history of living on the streets and has ties to Edmonton where he spent years on the street there. He also has various medical concerns. It is believed that Mr. Lathlin is likely in Winnipeg of his own volition. Mr. Lathlin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2016034139.CaseDesc: Jessie Lobban has not been seen since June 16, 2016 when he left his residence at an unknown time. Jessie left behind his vehicle and his bicycle. This is out of character for him and his family is concerned.

Deformity: Left Little Finger, Tip bent inward
Right Little Finger, Tip bent inward

Case reference: 2014002145.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1975, Mr. Garson with his father, brother and a friend set out for Moose Lake to hunt. On September 14, other hunters found gas cans, and a thermos with the name of Garson on it. These hunters reported their findings to police.  A search was initiated and police found a boat submerged upright on the bottom of the lake. The depth of the lake around the boat was only 8 to 10 feet deep. It appeared to Police that the men encountered extremely rough water while crossing Moose Lake. The motors were both found to be in forward gear. There was no floatation gear in the boat and it was heavily loaded with camping and hunting equipment. All of the bodies were recovered with the exception of M. Garson. It is presumed Mr. Garson drowned.

Case reference: 2014030834.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1967 at approximately 9:00 a.m. John Pawloski, his common-law wife and a young boy (9 years old) were fishing in the area of Pointe du Bois, Manitoba. John's fishing rod started to slip into the water and he ran to reach at it. He fell into the fast moving water. His wife attempted to rescue him, but she too slipped on the rocks and fell into the water. The young boy ran to get help and when he looked back he could no longer see the couple.  The body of John's wife was found down the river shortly after the incident. Searches for John's body were done by air, land and water but the body was never found. He is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014002857.CaseDesc: Colin Campbell was last seen March 12, 1998. Mr.Campbell was seen jumping off the Reversing Falls Bridge in Saint John, NB. His body has not been recovered.

Case reference: 2014004558.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1992, at approximately 9:00am, Rodolfo Morales was last heard from when he spoke to his friend over the telephone.

Case reference: 2011000399.CaseDesc: Kathy Bordato was reported missing in early February, 2010.  Police believe that she was last seen on or about August 16, 2009, between 7:00 and 8:30 am in the area of Cavendish Park near Walnut Street in London, Ontario. Police conducted a search of the area where Ms. Bordato was last seen and believe there are still witnesses with information to offer in relation to the investigation.

Tattoo: Left Hand, Tattoo of female  symbol between thumb and finger, left hand

Case reference: 2014005958.CaseDesc: Dallas Broich was last seen at his residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on October 8, 2012. He was supposed to report for work in Fort McMurray, Alberta, the following day but never arrived. Dallas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001617.CaseDesc: On January 25, 1976, Camille Lessard was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. He regularly went to the tavern located on the corner of Papineau  and Sainte-Catherine East in the Le Village district of Montreal, Quebec. Camille suffers from memory loss.

Case reference: 2014006098.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, Mr. Ménard left Quebec to travel to Mexico by car with his dog. When returning home on March 14, 2013, he was denied entry to the United States at the US Customs in Nuevo Laredo because his dog was carrying ticks. Therefore, he stayed in Mexico and has not been seen since. His vehicle and his dog were recovered after having been stolen. The individuals interviewed for the vehicle theft provided no information into Mr. Ménard's disappearance.

Case reference: 2006008499.CaseDesc: Anthony Huss was last seen November 08, 1975 leaving the Bon Aire Motel. He indicated that he was travelling to Chapleau. His vehicle was located, abandoned in a bush area near Smokey Falls, Kipling Township, District of Cochrane. Mr. Huss has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020078.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1990, Anthony Whitehead was last seen at a party on the Gordon's First Nation, SK. Searches and investigation over the years have failed to locate Mr. Whitehead.

Tattoo: Skull with hat on one arm, unknown which arm
Left Hand, Phyllis Bluecloud covered to look like a bar
Middle Back, Skull and dragon, others

Case reference: 2014001471.CaseDesc: Martin Gant had not been seen by his wife since November 27, 1961, when he destined to Corral, Chile in South America to install machinery in a cannery where he had a contract.

Case reference: 2021030286.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2021, Mona Hu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Mona had been in contact with her family in China, and was arranging to travel to see them.

Case reference: 2015011639.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1986, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-40, was found in the waters of Pier 2 of the La Ronde marina on St. Helen’s Island in Montreal, Quebec.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teething is natural with dentistry work. He could have had two partial dentures.
Sweater: White, Blue, T-shirt with blue sleeves

Case reference: 2018043211.CaseDesc: On December 18, 1995, at approximately 8:00am, Sukhia Budhram was seen for the last time when she moved out of her son’s apartment in Toronto, Ontario. Since then, Sukhia has not had any contact with her family.

Case reference: 2008008198.CaseDesc: Gerald Hart was last seen at around midnight on Christmas Eve on Symmes St, travelling on foot towards Main St in the City of Niagara Falls (the casino district).  Mr. Hart was reported to have been in an intoxicated state.

Case reference: 2014001761.CaseDesc: Henrietta Mille is originally from Nain, Newfoundland and had been living in St. John’s, Newfoundland for quite some time before her disappearance. Henrietta was known to frequent the clubs in the St. John’s downtown area. Her keys, purse and other belongings were found at the Key Club.

Case reference: 2014001103.CaseDesc: On June 26, 1990, an unidentified man was found in the whirlpool of the Niagara River. He had a muscular build, may have had mild emphysema and his appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for at least 6 months.

Case reference: 2018041446.CaseDesc: On April 20, 1998, Richard Opato was last known to be in the region of Niagara Falls, Ontario at approximately 5:30 p.m. There has been no news of his whereabouts or well being since this time.

Hair: Brown, Short, Other, Losing hair on the top of his head

Case reference: 2014004918.CaseDesc: On September 15th, 1993, three men were en route to Wuskwatim Lake via the Burntwood River intending to engage in commercial fishing. The men departed Nelson House, according to the only survivor they hit a rock and the motor quit. The boat was not equipped with a starter and the men were unable to restart the boat prior to going through the rapids.   Despite an intensive land, water and air search the bodies of Mr. Moose and Mr. Spence were never recovered.

Case reference: 2019056482.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 26, 2019, Gregory Paul Agnew was seen for the last time in his green Pontiac Sunfire, leaving a mushroom picker’s camp located at the 11km mark on the Kinsckutch Forest Service Road in New Aiyansh, to run errands in Terrace, British Columbia. On the evening of September 27, 2019, the Pontiac Sunfire was observed at his campsite along with his camper van, but Gregory was not there. An extensive search of the area was conducted with no success. Gregory has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018039090.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1996, at approximately 10:00 a.m., San Lee was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, San was terminally ill and despondent.

Case reference: 2022000648.CaseDesc: Murray Marsden went missing from Calgary, Alberta, sometime between April 29, 2010, and December 28, 2021.

Scar: Left Eye, Scar located in left eyebrow
Deformity: Left Hand, Left hand fingers are flexed

Case reference: 2014006252.CaseDesc: On September 12, 2013, Meagan Rose Pilon was seen for the last time at her family home in Sudbury, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Meagan was living in the New Sudbury area. Police have not been able to rule out foul play in her disappearance.

Mark: Left Chest, Red birthmark on inner left breast

Case reference: 2014005703.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1964, Harold Jackman was seen for the last time at his farm in Shillington, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Mr. Jackman wandered away from his farm.

Case reference: 2007000199.CaseDesc: Eric Ram was last seen at 9:00 a.m., on October 5, 1991.  He left his residence to go to the local store to buy milk and a paper and never returned.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Thick brown beard, moustache
Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2017027475.CaseDesc: On May 14, 2017, Roman Mussabekov was seen for the last time when he boarded a flight at the Montreal-Pierre-Elliott-Trudeau International Airport in Montreal, Quebec. He checked-in at a hotel on the island of Antigua in the Caribbean, but did not check-out. Roman contacted his mother a few days after his arrival to tell her that he was going on a hike in the mountains. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Short, Straight, Short on the sides, longer on top

Case reference: 2014002305.CaseDesc: On January 24, 1983, Dennis Howe was seen for the last time at his place of work at 333 Spadina Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004973.CaseDesc: Luke Retieff was last seen by his mother at his residence on July 21, 2007. He had been prescribed numerous medications for his medical conditions. He was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Wavy, Light brown goatee
Boots: Leather, Brown, hiking boots, shoe size 9 - 10
Coat: Nylon, Red, Ski jacket with black and white stripes on arms

Case reference: 2018033880.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2005, Quang Le was seen for the last time by his landlord in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017045625.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1997, the skeletal remains of a man were found in a wooded area in Notre-Dame-de-Porneuf, Quebec.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Chest, 2nd rib on right side healed

Case reference: 2007003099.CaseDesc: Christina Calayca was camping with friends at Rainbow Falls Provincial Park located near Schreiber, Ontario. At approximately 6:30 am Ms. Calayca indicated to a friend that she was going jogging and was last observed on a park campground roadway. Ms. Calayca never returned to her campsite and has not been heard from since. An extensive ground and air search has been conducted by the Ontario Provincial Police but Ms. Calayca has not been located.

Case reference: 2014001173.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1979, this unidentified individual was involved in a fatal motor vehicle collision near Wildwood, Alberta, and the remains were burned beyond recognition. The individual is believed to be a hitchhiker from Quebec, possibly named John. There are no dental restorations present and a few teeth had been extracted.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, Ski Jacket, Ski jacket with red and white stripes on the sleeve

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2020011692.CaseDesc: Joyce MacDougall was last heard from on March 13, 1986, at approximately 7:30pm. Joyce telephoned her mother to inform her that she was going out for a few drinks, but she never returned home. On March 14, Joyce interacted with the police in Niagara Falls and during the course of the interaction she was issued a ticket and was taken to a restaurant. She was last seen at the restaurant by a server and had left her purse in the restaurant.

Mark: Cheek, Mole on the left side of the cheek

Case reference: 2021056669.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2016, the remains of an unidentified man were recovered from Porcupine Strand, near Cartwright, Newfoundland. He may have been of Indigenous or Caucasian ancestry.

Case reference: 2018035793.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2018, Desmond Fischer was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go for a walk in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan. Desmond is known for following a very strict routine, and his disappearance is out of character.

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2014004457.CaseDesc: Stephon Payne was last seen at his residence on October 6, 2002. On the same day, Stephon was seen in the area of 106 Avenue and 84 Street, Edmonton, Alberta. Stephon may have also been in the area of the Dawson Bridge in Edmonton. A jacket believed to be Stephon’s was found at the bridge.

Case reference: 2014004809.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Peterson was reported missing on August 7, 2006, by a family member.  Investigators were advised that Mr. Peterson's vehicle was not taken and that he does not have a history of leaving without first communicating with them. It was later determined that Mr. Peterson was last seen by a neighbor, close to his residence in Manitou, Manitoba, on the afternoon of August 5, 2006.  Numerous searches were conducted of Manitou and the surrounding area, none of which were successful.

Case reference: 2014002340.CaseDesc:
Margaret Schochenmaier was last seen on November 30, 1985, sometime after 3:00pm.  On that day Margaret was in the process of moving from her son's residence; but she never finished the move.
Margaret has previously gone missing in the past, usually for a few days to one month.

Scar: Forehead, Small scar on the left side

Case reference: 2016068490.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1971, Mr. Georges Turcotte went missing from the Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec area. Georges was last seen at his home with his wife.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Snake or zig zag

Case reference: 2016066831.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1971, an autopsy was performed on the unidentified remains of a male. The exact location where the deceased was found is unknown at this point, but is in the Windsor area. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was uncircumsized. He is believed to have been dead for a few days to a few weeks.

Teeth: Four front upper incisors had been filled with gold amalgam.

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2014047580.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1979, an unidentified Caucasian male, approximately 50 years old, suffered a major medical trauma while in the Safeway store on 97St and 107Av in Edmonton, Alberta. He was rushed to the Royal Alexandra Hospital Intensive Care Unit. The man died in the hospital the following day. The Medical Examiner's office took photos of the man and forwarded them to the Edmonton Police Department (now Service). The Medical Examiner's Office deemed the death to be the result of natural causes.

Case reference: 2014003706.CaseDesc: Albert Crow and a friend attempted to cross Harrop Lake, Manitoba in a canoe despite high winds and the rough water. A second party in another canoe was ahead of Mr. Crow's and observed at one point of the crossing that the canoe was no longer visible. Searches were made of the shoreline and dragging operations of the lake were undertaken at the time without success. On October 12, 1974, the body of Mr. Crow's friend was recovered. His cause of death was later determined to be drowning. Albert Crow is presumed also dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2005005299.CaseDesc:
On January 2, 1995, the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified man were found in front of a children's playground adjacent to Lake Ontario near Navy and Front Streets in Oakville. 
The time since death is estimated to be months to several years.

Case reference: 2006009599.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Ann Kant has been missing since October 16, 1972. She had been with a hunting party in Adair Township, approximately 73 miles east of Cochrane and was last seen about 2.4 miles south of Camp # 23, Abitibi limits.

Jewelry: Gold, White, Yellow, ring; wedding band
Jacket: Black, Red, men's plaid hunting jacket
Pants: Green, Ski slacks with elastic strap under the feet
Scar: Right Foot, from bone spur surgery
